name: infra-aws
description: Terraform provider resources for provisioning and managing AWS infrastructure including Lambda, S3, and IAM.

members.name: aws_lambda_function
members.description: Provides a Lambda Function resource. Lambda allows you to run code without provisioning or managing servers.

parameters.name: function_name
parameters.description: Unique name for the Lambda function

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: IAM role ARN for execution permissions

examples.title: Basic Lambda function
examples.code:
resource "aws_lambda_function" "hello" {
  function_name = "hello-world"
  runtime       = "nodejs20.x"
  handler       = "index.handler"
  role          = aws_iam_role.lambda_exec.arn
  filename      = "lambda.zip"
}

members.name: aws_s3_bucket
members.description: Provides an S3 bucket resource for object storage.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Name of the bucket (must be globally unique)

members.name: aws_iam_role
members.description: Provides an IAM role resource for defining permissions.

parameters.name: assume_role_policy
parameters.description: JSON trust policy for who can assume this role

guides.title: Getting Started with AWS Provider
guides.summary: Configure Terraform for AWS and create your first resource

sections.title: Configure the Provider
sections.summary: Set up AWS credentials and region
sections.content: Add the AWS provider block to your Terraform configuration with region and credential settings.

sections.title: Create Your First Resource
sections.content: Define an `aws_s3_bucket` resource and run `terraform apply` to create it.
